messages.subject: Re: Neopets:  It's no WoW...
messages.msgSnippet: ... We stopped playing for a while, once we figured out you couldn t use neopoints to buy the wearable stuff, only neocash. Good news is the Advent calendar
messages.messageBody:
--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, "tracyliebmann"
<tracyliebmann@...> wrote:
>
> My kids say they don't like neopets anymore because all the cool
> stuff cost money now <g> FREE is good. Tracy
>

We stopped playing for a while, once we figured out you couldn't use
neopoints to buy the wearable stuff, only neocash.

Good news is the Advent calendar has given us a FREE wearable item on
each day so far.

Jen H.

http://crazychicknlady.livejournal.com/

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Neopets: It's no WoW...
messages.msgSnippet: ... I know! We had a neopets account a few years ago and it was fun. Kids weren t really intrigued by it at the time, but I played. :)  Now they are interested
messages.messageBody:
> My kids say they don't like neopets anymore because all the cool
> stuff cost money now <g> FREE is good.


I know! We had a neopets account a few years ago and it was fun. Kids
weren't really intrigued by it at the time, but I played. :) Now they are
interested and want their own accounts. So we signed up and discovered that
things require "neocash" now. Appreciate the heads-up on the free stuff -
that rocks!!

All the sites the kids really like right now - such as brainpop, adventure
quest, club penguin - allow limited free play, but require a subscription or
purchase of "points" or whatever the platform calls money (poe, bucks, etc).
I've tried to wrap my head around it... and figure out how it's possible to
afford these subscriptions and purchases each month for every site. Club
Penguin is fairly reasonable - $5.95 - but others want $30 to $50 or more a
month to be a "full" member. It starts adding up fast!

We just got Mehalje a BarbieGirl mp3 player ($50) which allows her to use
all the features of the bariegirl website - hooking the player to the
computer is the only option available to get full access. After plugging it
in and registering it, we found out it only gives her a 1 year subscription
to the site. Not saying she'll still be interested in it a year from now,
but if she is I guess the site designers expect us to go out and buy another
mp3 player to continue her subscription?

Gotta go, kids want to run to the movie store.

~ Susan


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Neopets:  It's no WoW...
messages.msgSnippet: It s no World of Warcraft, for sure, but for those with Neopets accounts, it s December, the best time to play Neopets. Every day in December there are points
messages.messageBody:
It's no World of Warcraft, for sure, but for those with Neopets
accounts, it's December, the best time to play Neopets.

Every day in December there are points and gifts just for going to
the advent calendar.
http://www.neopets.com/winter/adventcalendar.phtml
(Terror Mountain, the topmost "continent," to the right)

Monthly freebies, new month too:

http://www.neopets.com/freebies/index.phtml

Sandra
